intro: Nengella microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited nengella, is a flowering plant native to the Cape region of South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of the region. It features trifoliate leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
